plugin.name: ðŸ“¦ Filer
plugin.description: Help file (move) the current paragraph, selected paragraphs, or heading and its section, to different notes. Please see details for more, err, details.
plugin.author: jgclark

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Today's note
plugin.commands.description: quick move paragraphs to Today's note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Tomorrow's note
plugin.commands.description: quick move paragraphs to Tomorrow's daily note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Weekly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move paragraphs to the current Weekly note

plugin.commands.name: quick move to Next Weekly note
plugin.commands.description: quick move paragraphs to Next Week's note

plugin.commands.name: new note from selection
plugin.commands.description: New note from selection (and leave link to it in its place)

plugin.commands.name: add sync'd copy to note
plugin.commands.description: Add a sync'd copy of the current line to a section in another note

plugin.settings.title: Add date reference?
plugin.settings.description: If true, adds date reference on the moved paragraph(s) when moved from a daily note.

plugin.settings.title: Date reference style
plugin.settings.description: The style of added date reference on a moved note: add either 'link' ('>date') or 'at' ('@date') or 'date' (a formatted date string).

plugin.settings.title: Use extended block definition?
plugin.settings.description: Controls whether all the lines in the current heading's section are included in the block to move (true) or whether only the following ones that are more deeply indented are included (false; this is the default). In both cases a block is closed by a blank line or a separator (horizontal line).

plugin.settings.title: Where to add in section
plugin.settings.description: Controls whether moved lines get inserted at the "start" or "end" of the chosen section.
